org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue

Class AbstractKeyValueBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.AbstractKeyValueBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyValueBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicKeyValueBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractKeyValueBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements KeyValueBuilder
    AbstractKeyValueBuilder that holds information about the mapping between classes and their PersistenceRenderers, and specifies the separator to be used between the elements of the key.

      • AbstractKeyValueBuilder

        public AbstractKeyValueBuilder(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,PersistenceRenderer> renderers,
                       PersistenceRenderer arrayRenderer,
                       java.lang.String separator)
        Constructs a basic key-value builder that uses the specified renderers and separator.
        Parameters:
        renderers - The mapping between the Class represented by an InfoNode and the PersistenceRenderer used to create the key-value pair.
        arrayRenderer - The PersistenceRenderer used to create key-value pairs for InfoNodes that represent an array.
        separator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key
        See Also:
        getRenderer(Class)

    • Method Detail

      • getSeparator

        public java.lang.String getSeparator()
        Specified by:
        getSeparator in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Returns:
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.

      • setSeparator

        public void setSeparator(java.lang.String separator)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.
        Specified by:
        setSeparator in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator

      • setShowFullKey

        public void setShowFullKey(boolean isShowFullKey)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        When set to true, the full key is persisted. So for example, normally, if there is a List of String called names, then the key will have the form names[i]. When this is set to true, then the List would have a key of the form names[i].String
        Specified by:
        setShowFullKey in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Parameters:
        isShowFullKey - true means that the full key will be persisted; false is default

      • isShowFullKey

        public boolean isShowFullKey()
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        When set to true, the full key is persisted. So for example, normally, if there is a List of String called names, then the key will have the form names[i]. When this is set to true, then the List would have a key of the form names[i].String
        Specified by:
        isShowFullKey in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Returns:
        true means that the full key will be persisted; false is default

      • putRenderer

        public PersistenceRenderer putRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                              PersistenceRenderer renderer)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Puts an association between a Class and a PersistenceRenderer into the mapping. This call replaces existing associations, in that case, returning the previous PersistenceRenderer.
        Specified by:
        putRenderer in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class with which to associate the PersistenceRenderer
        renderer - The PersistenceRenderer to be associated with the specified Class
        Returns:
        the PersistenceRenderer that was previously associated with the specified Class or null if no association existed.

      • removeRenderer

        public PersistenceRenderer removeRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Removes the Class from any association with the PersistenceRenderer. Use this method if you think that the specified Class is above any such undesirable associations.
        Specified by:
        removeRenderer in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to remove
        Returns:
        the PersistenceRenderer that was associated with the specified Class so that it can be dealt with properly, or null if no such association existed, and this was a false accusation.

      • getRenderer

        public PersistenceRenderer getRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Returns the renderer for the specified Class or null if the specified Class doesn't have an associated renderer. The returned renderer will either be the renderer associated with:
        • the specified Class
        • the renderer associated with the closest ancestor
        • null if neither of the previous two are found
        Specified by:
        getRenderer in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for which to return the renderer.
        Returns:
        the renderer for the specified Class or null if the specified Class.

      • getRenderer

        public PersistenceRenderer getRenderer(java.lang.String key)
        Finds the PersistenceRenderer for which the specified key matches its regular expression for keys; null if no PersistenceRenderer is found.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to test
        Returns:
        the PersistenceRenderer for which the specified key matches its regular expression for keys; null if no PersistenceRenderer is found.

      • containsRenderer

        public boolean containsRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Finds the PersistenceRenderer associated with the class. If the specified class doesn't have a renderer, then it searches for the closest parent class (inheritance) and returns that. In this case, it adds an entry to the persistence renderer map for the specified class associating it with the returned persistence renderer (performance speed-up for subsequent calls).
        Specified by:
        containsRenderer in interface KeyValueBuilder
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class for which to find a persistence renderer
        Returns:
        the true if a persistence renderer was found; false otherwise
